purpleculture_pinyin:
xiù
sleeve; to tuck inside one's sleeve
рукав; засунуть в рукав
rtega_mnemonic:
袖袖RSsleeve, put something in sleeve
  • part of clothing 衣 where arms stick through like a young plant sticking out of the field 由
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 由 indicates the sound; 衤 (clothes) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
领袖 [ lǐng xiù ]: leader; Classifiers: 个
衣袖 [ yī xiù ]: the sleeve of a garment
袖口 [ xiù kǒu ]: cuff
袖手旁观 [ xiù shǒu páng guān ]: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
两袖清风 [ liǎng xiù qīng fēng ]: lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands; uncorrupted; unsoiled by corrupt practices
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 衤 [ yī ] cloth
    • 由 [ yóu ] cause, reason; from
heisig_chinese_memo: The bad magician says, "As you can see, there's nothing up my sleeves!" Then he trips over his cloak and brussel sprouts fall everywhere.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: sleeve, wing (building), extension, give cold shoulder
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: рукав, крыло (корпус), расширение, дает холодное плечо
koohiiStory1: Imagine some magic cloak, that when worn, has little green sprouts appearing on the sides that grow into sleeves.
koohiiStory2: The bad magician says, "As you can see, there´s nothing up my sleeves!" Then he trips over his cloak and brussel sprouts fall everywhere.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A mix of spirit and reason helped you invent the sleeve. Your spirit told you your arms were uncomfortable, stuck to your sides under that shirt. Reason told you that maybe, just maybe, if you made holes for your arms something good would come out of it. And that's how sleeves were born!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Your spirit and your arms are free! Imagine how unreasonable no sleeves were. How on earth did you survive without them?!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: To make the sleeve holes you took your shoe (しゅう) and kicked a hole through your shirt. Then you did it again on the other side, because you have two of those weird arm things.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You also take the extra fabric that helped make your sleeves and turned them into another pair of really light shoes, since they're shoe shaped from the whole process anyway. Waste not!
Ru_Meaning: sleeve, wing (building), extension, give cold shoulder
Kanshudo_mnemonic: there's a reason (由) clothes (衤) have sleeves
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The bad magician says, "As you can see, there's nothing up my sleeves!" Then he trips over his cloak and brussel sprouts fall everywhere.
humanum_short_description_en: " Sleeve " is the ancient work "褎", see "褎".

袖字的基本解释

袖
xiù
衣服套在胳膊上的部分：袖子。套袖。袖标。
藏在袖子里：袖藏。袖手旁观。袖刃（袖藏利刃）。

袖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiù］
［《廣韻》似祐切，去宥，邪。］
“褎1”的今字。亦作“褏1”。
(1)衣袖。
(2)藏于袖中。

袖字的英文翻译

◎ 袖
sleeve

袖字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　袖； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1114第17
〔古文〕褏【唐韻】似祐切【集韻】似救切，?音岫。袂也。【釋名】袖，由也，手所由出入也。亦言受也。以受手也。【後漢·馬廖傳】城中好大袖，四方全匹帛。　又【綱目集覽】半袖，短袂衣也。【釋名】半袖其袂半，襦而施袖也。【晉書·五行志】魏明帝披縹綾半袖。　【廣韻】亦作褏、褎。

袖字的源字形

袖字的起名意思

：袖子，衣服套在胳膊上的部分。长袖善舞，组词领袖。

Radicals: ネ, 由  (spirit, reason)
Meaning Mnemonic
A mix of spirit and reason helped you invent the sleeve. Your spirit told you your arms were uncomfortable, stuck to your sides under that shirt. Reason told you that maybe, just maybe, if you made holes for your arms something good would come out of it. And that's how sleeves were born!
Your spirit and your arms are free! Imagine how unreasonable no sleeves were. How on earth did you survive without them?!
Reading Mnemonic
To make the sleeve holes you took your shoe (しゅう) and kicked a hole through your shirt. Then you did it again on the other side, because you have two of those weird arm things.
You also take the extra fabric that helped make your sleeves and turned them into another pair of really light shoes, since they're shoe shaped from the whole process anyway. Waste not!
